meanings.definition: To become subject to (something unwelcome or unpleasant)
meanings.sent1: She did not expect to incurrence such a heavy workload.
meanings.sent2: After ignoring the warning signs, he finally incurrence the consequences.
meanings.sent3: The cat's incurrence of a bath led to a hilarious chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: His decision to skip breakfast incurrence a growling stomach during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunderstorm outside made the incurrence of fear in the children.

meanings.definition: The act of acquiring or becoming subject to (something unwelcome or unpleasant)
meanings.sent1: The incurrence of a cold left her feeling miserable.
meanings.sent2: The incurrence of debt can be a heavy burden on a family.
meanings.sent3: His constant incurrence of parking tickets became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The incurrence of a new responsibility at work added to her stress levels.
meanings.sent5: The sudden incurrence of a storm caught everyone by surprise.
